p: The National Healthcare Group Domain Specific Review Board and the Bioethics Review Committee of the National Environment Agency/Environmental Health Institute approved the 2013 and 2017 studies, respectively. Written informed consent to test the serum samples for infectious diseases was obtained from the blood donors as part of the Donor Health Assessment Questionnaire. In addition, parental consent was obtained for donors below 18 years of age. Donor identifiers were removed, and only the age, sex, residency status, and residential postal code of each participant were retained.
